mfa.setupRequiredDescription: Your organization requires all users to set up two-factor authentication. Please complete the setup to continue.
mfa.cannotSkipSetup: You cannot skip MFA setup. Please complete the setup to access the application.

troubleshooting.title: Troubleshooting
troubleshooting.undefined_vars: Undefined variables will render as empty strings. Use conditionals to handle missing data gracefully.
troubleshooting.empty_values_desc: If a variable shows nothing, it may be empty or undefined. Wrap it in a conditional block.
troubleshooting.syntax_errors_desc: Common syntax issues include missing closing braces or endif statements.
troubleshooting.type_specific_desc: Some variables are only available for specific document types (e.g., certificate.* is only for Medical Certificates).

help.title: Help Center
help.description: Find answers to common questions and learn how to use DocPat

overview.title: Welcome to DocPat
overview.subtitle: Your comprehensive medical practice management solution
overview.intro: DocPat helps you manage patients, appointments, visits, prescriptions, and documents efficiently. This help center provides guides, FAQs, and troubleshooting tips to help you get the most out of the system.
overview.quick_links_description: Jump to frequently used help topics
overview.link_new_patient: How to add a new patient
overview.support_description: If you can't find what you're looking for, contact your system administrator for assistance.

getting_started.title: Getting Started
getting_started.subtitle: Learn the basics of DocPat in just a few minutes
getting_started.intro: Follow these steps to get up and running with DocPat quickly.

login.title: 1. Logging In
login.content: Navigate to the DocPat login page and enter your username and password. If two-factor authentication (MFA) is enabled, you'll need to enter the 6-digit code from your authenticator app. Use the 'Remember Me' option to stay logged in on trusted devices.

navigation.title: 2. Navigating the Interface
navigation.content: The sidebar on the left provides access to all main features: Dashboard, Patients, Appointments, Visits, Prescriptions, Documents, Reports, and Notifications. Admin users also see Administration options. The top bar contains notifications, language/theme switchers, and your profile menu.

first_patient.title: 3. Adding Your First Patient
first_patient.content: Go to Patients in the sidebar, then click 'New Patient'. Fill in the required fields (name, date of birth, contact information) and any optional details like insurance information. Click 'Save' to create the patient record.

schedule.title: 4. Scheduling Appointments
schedule.content: Navigate to Appointments to view the calendar. Click on an empty time slot or use the 'New Appointment' button. Select a patient, choose the appointment type, set the date and time, and save. The system prevents double-booking automatically.

visit.title: 5. Recording Visits
visit.content: When a patient arrives, go to Visits and create a new visit. Use the SOAP format (Subjective, Objective, Assessment, Plan) to document findings. Record vital signs, add diagnoses using ICD-10 codes, and save as Draft until ready to sign.

prescriptions.title: 6. Creating Prescriptions
prescriptions.content: From a visit or the Prescriptions page, create new prescriptions. Select medications from the database or add custom ones. The system checks for drug interactions automatically. Set dosage, frequency, and refill information, then save or print.

documents.title: 7. Generating Documents
documents.content: Go to Documents to generate medical certificates, referral letters, lab requests, or visit summaries. Select a template, choose the patient and relevant visit, and generate the PDF. You can download or email documents directly to patients.

tips.title: Quick Tips
tips.tip1: Use keyboard shortcuts to navigate faster - press Ctrl+K to open quick search
tips.tip2: Switch between light and dark themes using the sun/moon icon in the header
tips.tip3: Change language between English and Italian from the header dropdown

features.title: Feature Guides
features.subtitle: Detailed guides for each module
features.intro: Select a feature below to learn more about its capabilities and how to use it effectively.

dashboard.title: Dashboard
dashboard.content: The Dashboard provides a quick overview of your practice with statistics cards showing patient counts, today's appointments, recent visits, and active prescriptions. Use the quick action buttons to create new patients, appointments, visits, or prescriptions directly from the dashboard.
features: View key statistics at a glance
Quick action buttons for common tasks
Click statistics cards to navigate to detailed views

patients.title: Patient Management
patients.content: The Patients module is the core of DocPat. Here you can manage all patient records including demographics, contact information, insurance details, medical history, allergies, and medications.
features: Create new patient records with comprehensive demographics
Search patients by name, ID, phone, or email
View patient history including visits, appointments, and prescriptions
Edit patient information and insurance details

appointments.title: Appointments
appointments.content: The Appointments module provides a full calendar interface for scheduling and managing patient appointments. View by day, week, or month, and track appointment statuses through their lifecycle.
features: Interactive calendar with day, week, and month views
Create appointments with type, duration, and notes
Status workflow: Scheduled → Confirmed → In Progress → Completed
Set up recurring appointments (daily, weekly, monthly)

visits.title: Clinical Visits
visits.content: Document patient encounters using the structured SOAP format. Record vital signs, diagnoses, and treatment plans. Sign visits digitally for legal compliance.
features: SOAP note format (Subjective, Objective, Assessment, Plan)
Visit templates for common encounter types

prescriptions.title: Prescriptions
prescriptions.content: Create and manage prescriptions with built-in safety features. The system checks for drug interactions and helps track refills and renewals.

documents.title: Documents
documents.content: Generate professional medical documents from customizable templates. Documents automatically populate with patient and visit data.
features: Pre-built templates for certificates, referrals, and lab requests
Custom template creation with variable syntax
Auto-populate patient, visit, and prescription data
Track document generation and delivery status

reports.title: Reports
reports.content: Generate reports to understand your practice performance. View appointment statistics, patient demographics, diagnosis trends, and provider productivity.
features: Export to PDF, CSV, or Excel

notifications.title: Notifications
notifications.content: Manage email notifications sent to patients including appointment reminders and document deliveries. Track delivery status and retry failed notifications.

admin.title: Administration
admin.content: Admin users can configure system settings, manage users, view audit logs, and monitor system health. This section is only visible to users with the Admin role.

faq.title: Frequently Asked Questions
faq.subtitle: Quick answers to common questions
faq.intro: Browse or search frequently asked questions organized by category.

what_is_docpat.question: What is DocPat?
what_is_docpat.answer: DocPat is a comprehensive medical practice management system designed for individual practitioners. It helps you manage patients, appointments, clinical visits, prescriptions, and documents in one secure, easy-to-use application.

supported_browsers.question: Which browsers are supported?
supported_browsers.answer: DocPat works best with modern browsers including Chrome, Firefox, Safari, and Edge. We recommend keeping your browser updated to the latest version for the best experience and security.

mobile_support.question: Can I use DocPat on mobile devices?
mobile_support.answer: Yes, DocPat is responsive and works on tablets and smartphones. The interface adapts to smaller screens while maintaining full functionality.

change_language.question: How do I change the language?
change_language.answer: Click the language icon in the top header bar and select your preferred language (English or Italian). Your preference is saved automatically.

change_theme.question: How do I switch between light and dark mode?
change_theme.answer: Click the sun/moon icon in the top header bar to toggle between light and dark themes. Your preference is saved automatically.

reset_password.question: How do I reset my password?
reset_password.answer: Click 'Forgot password?' on the login page. Enter your email address and follow the instructions sent to your inbox. If you don't receive an email, check your spam folder or contact your administrator.

enable_mfa.question: How do I enable two-factor authentication?
enable_mfa.answer: Go to your Profile (click your name in the header), scroll to Security Settings, and click 'Enable MFA'. Scan the QR code with an authenticator app like Google Authenticator or Authy, then enter the verification code to complete setup.

mfa_lost_phone.question: What if I lose access to my authenticator app?
mfa_lost_phone.answer: Contact your system administrator to reset your MFA settings. They can disable MFA on your account so you can set it up again with a new device.

session_timeout.question: Why does my session expire?
session_timeout.answer: For security, sessions expire after a period of inactivity (typically 30 minutes). This protects patient data if you leave your computer unattended. You'll need to log in again when this happens.

add_patient.question: How do I add a new patient?
add_patient.answer: Navigate to Patients from the sidebar, click 'New Patient', fill in the required fields (name, date of birth, contact info), and click 'Save'. You can add optional information like insurance details and medical history.

search_patients.question: How do I search for a patient?
search_patients.answer: Use the search bar at the top of the Patients page. You can search by patient name, medical record number, phone number, or email address. Results update as you type.

delete_patient.question: Can I delete a patient record?
delete_patient.answer: Patient records cannot be deleted to maintain medical record integrity. Instead, you can deactivate a patient record which removes them from active lists while preserving their history for compliance.

schedule_appointment.question: How do I schedule an appointment?
schedule_appointment.answer: Go to Appointments, click on an empty time slot in the calendar or use the 'New Appointment' button. Select the patient, choose the appointment type, set the date and time, and save.

recurring_appointments.question: Can I set up recurring appointments?
recurring_appointments.answer: Yes, when creating an appointment, expand the 'Recurring' section and select the frequency (daily, weekly, bi-weekly, or monthly). Set the end date or maximum number of occurrences.

cancel_appointment.question: How do I cancel an appointment?
cancel_appointment.answer: Open the appointment details, click the 'Cancel' button, optionally enter a cancellation reason, and confirm. Cancelled appointments are marked in the calendar but preserved for records.

appointment_conflict.question: Why can't I book an appointment at a certain time?
appointment_conflict.answer: The system prevents double-booking. If a time slot is already taken, you'll need to choose a different time. Check the calendar view to see existing appointments.

create_visit.question: How do I create a visit note?
create_visit.answer: Go to Visits and click 'New Visit', or create a visit from a patient's profile. Select the patient, choose the visit type, and document using the SOAP format. Save as Draft until ready to sign.

sign_visit.question: What does signing a visit do?
sign_visit.answer: Signing a visit adds your digital signature and timestamp, indicating you've reviewed and approved the documentation. Signed visits cannot be edited, only amended with additional notes.

lock_visit.question: What's the difference between signing and locking a visit?
lock_visit.answer: Signing indicates provider approval and prevents editing. Locking is an additional step that archives the visit permanently, typically used after all follow-up documentation is complete.

visit_templates.question: How do I use visit templates?
visit_templates.answer: When creating a new visit, select a template from the dropdown. The template pre-fills common fields based on the visit type. You can customize the content after applying the template.

create_prescription.question: How do I create a prescription?
create_prescription.answer: Go to Prescriptions or create from within a visit. Click 'New Prescription', select the patient, search for or add the medication, set dosage and frequency, and save. You can then print or email the prescription.

drug_interactions.question: What do the drug interaction warnings mean?
drug_interactions.answer: The system checks for interactions between prescribed medications. Warnings are color-coded: Red (contraindicated - avoid), Orange (major - serious risk), Yellow (moderate - caution), Blue (minor - low risk). Review all warnings before finalizing prescriptions.

renew_prescription.question: How do I renew a prescription?
renew_prescription.answer: Find the prescription in the list, click the renew icon or button. This creates a new prescription with the same details that you can adjust if needed before saving.

custom_medication.question: Can I prescribe medications not in the database?
custom_medication.answer: Yes, click 'Custom Medication' when creating a prescription to manually enter medication details including name, form, strength, and instructions.

generate_document.question: How do I generate a document?
generate_document.answer: Go to Documents, click 'Generate Document', select a template type (certificate, referral, etc.), choose the patient and relevant visit if applicable, and click Generate. The PDF will be created and available for download.

email_document.question: Can I email documents to patients?
email_document.answer: Yes, from the document list, click the email icon on any generated document. Enter or confirm the patient's email address and send. The system tracks delivery status.

create_template.question: How do I create a custom document template?
create_template.answer: Admin users can go to Documents > Templates, click 'New Template', and use the template editor. Use variables like {{patient.name}} to auto-populate data. Refer to the Template Help Guide for syntax.

data_security.question: How is patient data protected?
data_security.answer: DocPat uses AES-256 encryption for sensitive data at rest and TLS 1.3 for data in transit. All access is logged in the audit trail, and row-level security ensures users only see authorized data.

audit_logs.question: What are audit logs?
audit_logs.answer: Audit logs record all significant actions in the system including data access, modifications, and user activities. Admin users can view audit logs for compliance and security monitoring.

troubleshooting.title: Troubleshooting
troubleshooting.subtitle: Solutions to common issues
troubleshooting.intro: Find solutions to common problems. If your issue isn't listed here, contact your system administrator.

cannot_login.issue: Cannot log in to my account
solutions: Verify your username and password are correct (check for typos)
Check if Caps Lock is enabled on your keyboard
Try the 'Forgot password?' option to reset your password
Clear your browser cache and cookies, then try again
Try a different browser or incognito/private mode
Contact your administrator if the problem persists
Ensure your device's time is synchronized correctly
Wait for a new code to generate (codes change every 30 seconds)
Make sure you're using the correct account in your authenticator app
Try manually entering the code instead of copying/pasting
Contact your administrator to reset MFA if needed
This is normal security behavior - sessions expire after inactivity
Use 'Remember Me' when logging in to extend session duration
Check your network connection - disconnections can end sessions
Avoid using multiple tabs with DocPat simultaneously
Contact admin if timeout is too short for your workflow
Check your internet connection speed
Clear browser cache and cookies
Close unnecessary browser tabs and applications
Try a different browser
Disable browser extensions that might interfere
If problem persists, contact your administrator

page_not_responding.issue: Page is not responding or freezing
solutions: Wait a few moments - complex operations may take time
Refresh the page (you may lose unsaved work)
Check your internet connection
Clear browser cache and restart the browser
Try accessing from a different device
Report the issue to your administrator with details
Check for validation errors - required fields may be empty
Look for error messages at the top of the form
Verify your internet connection is stable
Make sure you clicked the 'Save' button
Try refreshing the page and re-entering the data
Contact administrator if the problem persists

missing_data.issue: Data I entered is missing or not showing
solutions: Refresh the page to load the latest data
Check if you're using filters that might hide the data
Verify you saved the data before navigating away
Check if another user might have modified the record
Review the audit log for changes (admin users)
Contact administrator if data appears lost
Wait a few moments - document generation takes time
Check the document status in the Documents list
Refresh the page and try generating again
Ensure all required data (patient, template) is selected
Check if there are template errors
Contact administrator if generation repeatedly fails

print_layout_wrong.issue: Printed document has incorrect layout or formatting
solutions: Use 'Print' from the browser or download PDF first
Check printer settings for correct paper size (A4)
Disable 'Scale to fit' in print settings
Set margins to 'Default' in print settings
Try printing from a different browser
Report template issues to administrator
Check the notification status in the Notifications page
Ask patient to check their spam/junk folder
Verify the patient's email address is correct
Try resending by clicking 'Retry' on failed notifications
Check if the email server is configured correctly (admin)
Contact administrator if emails consistently fail
Click 'Retry' to attempt sending again
Check the recipient email address is valid
Verify email server configuration (admin)
Check server logs for detailed error messages
Ensure email service is not rate-limited
Contact administrator to review email settings

shortcuts.title: Keyboard Shortcuts
shortcuts.subtitle: Speed up your workflow with keyboard shortcuts
shortcuts.intro: Use these keyboard shortcuts to navigate and perform actions more quickly.
shortcuts.note: Note: On macOS, use Cmd instead of Ctrl for most shortcuts.

contextual.patients_list: View and manage all patient records. Use search and filters to find specific patients quickly.
contextual.patient_form: Fill in patient details. Fields marked with * are required. Tab through fields or click to navigate.
contextual.appointment_calendar: Click on a time slot to create a new appointment. Drag appointments to reschedule. Use the view toggles for day, week, or month views.
contextual.visit_soap: Document visits using the SOAP format: Subjective (patient's complaints), Objective (findings), Assessment (diagnosis), Plan (treatment). All sections support rich text.
contextual.vital_signs: Record patient vital signs. Values are validated against normal ranges. BMI is calculated automatically from height and weight.
contextual.prescription_form: Search for medications or add custom ones. Check interaction warnings before saving. Set dosage, frequency, duration, and refill information.
contextual.prescription_interactions: Drug interaction warnings appear automatically. Red = avoid combination, Orange = serious risk, Yellow = caution needed, Blue = minor risk.
contextual.document_template: Use template variables like {{patient.name}} to auto-populate data. Preview the result before generating. See Template Guide for syntax help.
contextual.report_filters: Set date range to filter report data. Use the refresh button to update statistics. Export options available for all report types.
